site_name: County of Essex Turtle Back Zoo

citations.narrative:
On the morning of May 29, 2025, Jelly, the Black bear was able to leave her enclosure through an open gate and into a
rear area that was fully enclosed by fencing and walls. An employee failed to close the gate and reconnect the hotwire
before alerting another employee that they could let the bear out of holding and into the exhibit enclosure. The bear was
quickly returned to her enclosure without incident. However, the lack of fully ensuring that the enclosure was appropriately
secured, before the allowing the bear access to the enclosure, was not an acceptable level of husbandry practices.
Employees should be appropriately trained to ensure that the bear is completely secured to prevent such events of
escape from occurring.
A sufficient number of adequately trained employees shall be utilized to maintain the professionally acceptable level of
husbandry practices set forth in this subpart. Such practices shall be under a supervisor who has a background in animal
care.
TO BE CORRECTED BY: JUNE 23, 2024
This inspection was conducted with the facility representatives on June 2, 2025 and the exit briefing was conducted with
the Curator via phone call.
